alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 2:43PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles west of Zuni Pueblo to near Petrified Forest National Park. Movement was north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sanders, Houck, Petrified Forest National Park, Chambers and Petrified Forest N.P. Headquarters. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 299 and 359. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 387. Highway 191 161 between mile markers 349 and 368. State Route 61 between mile markers 423 and 429. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
